subject: Re: JUnit 4 with Ant & Eclipse
msgSnippet: ... Is it possible there s a bug in the  ant task that is looking only for JUnit3 tests?  Does the task need a version attribute to get it to use JUnit4
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "craig.noah2008" <craig.noah2008@...> wrote:
>
> I've written a collection of JUnit4 tests that run fine within
> Eclipse. I'm working on adding an Ant target to our build.xml file to
> run the entire collection of tests. The target works, but for every
> test class, I get the message, "no tests found in <TestClassName>.
> The listed properties include junit-4.4.jar assigned to the junit.jar
> property and the same junit-4.4.jar file is found in the Java classpath.
>
> Any ideas?
>
> Craig
>

Is it possible there's a bug in the <junit> ant task that is looking
only for JUnit3 tests? Does the task need a version attribute to get
it to use JUnit4 tests?
